<a href="style=%22border-bottom:none!important;%22" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="GE" style="width:100%;max-width: 57px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="57" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby80MzEvMTYzMTAzMDA2My11bm5hbWVkLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0="></a>

<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning and Happy Friday. </strong>And it’s an especially Happy Friday because we just read in <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/14/well/eat/seltzer-water-benefits.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this article</a> that carbonated water is in fact just as hydrating as regular water. It’s proof that if you believe something is good for you for long enough, eventually science will catch up.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">—<em>Matty Merritt</em>, <em>Neal Freyman, Sherry Qin </em></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/16/tax-rich-echoes-10-years-occupy-wall-street?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Occupy Wall Street Echoes 10 Years Later
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NEW YORK, NY - MARCH 24:  An Occupy Wall Street banner is seen in Union ..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDQwL29jY3VweV93YWxsX3N0cmVldF9tYXJjaGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Andrew Burton/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Tax the rich”: High fashion in September 2021, perhaps even more fashionable exactly 10 years ago.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On September 17, 2011, Occupy Wall Street began. Protesters first gathered in Lower Manhattan that day, railing against economic inequality and Wall Street’s influence on politics. Thousands set up camp in the neighborhood’s Zuccotti Park, remaining there until they were forced to leave two months later, in November.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While Occupy was centered in NYC, it went global, spreading to more than 600 communities in the US and many cities across the world. Inspired by the Arab Spring protests that had occurred the year before, demonstrators utilized social media in innovative ways to organize what was for all intents and purposes a leaderless movement. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2011, Time magazine named “The Protestor” as its Person of the Year. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Occupy’s legacy</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">People disagree about the long-term impact of Occupy Wall Street, with some calling it a flop and others arguing that it laid the groundwork for other progressive social and political movements.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The flop camp: </strong>One year after the protests, the NYT’s Andrew Ross Sorkin called Occupy “an <a href="https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2012/09/17/occupy-wall-street-a-frenzy-that-fizzled/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asterisk in the history books</a>, if it gets a mention at all,” arguing that it didn’t lead to any meaningful policy changes that would reform Wall Street.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even the person who is credited with spurring Occupy, Micah White, who was the editor of an anti-consumerist magazine at the time, told the Guardian he was <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/sep/12/occupy-wall-street-10-years-on?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disappointed</a> with the outcomes. “I think if you look at the last 10 years, activism has not worked,” he said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The “it mattered” camp: </strong>Others argue that, while Occupy may not have accomplished anything concrete, it introduced a generation to protesting and made marching in the streets on a Saturday cool again. They point to #MeToo, Black Lives Matter, and Bernie Sanders’s bid for the presidency as movements that borrowed heavily from the Occupy blueprint. —<em>NF</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/16/france-calls-usaustraliauk-submarine-deal-stab-back?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
France Says It Got Stabbed in the Back
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="France is angry over the submarine deal" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDQzL2FuZ3J5X2Nyb2lzc2FudC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US, Britain, and Australia signed a major nuclear submarine deal on Wednesday to contain China’s military power in the Pacific Ocean, blindsiding France like the only kid who didn’t get invited to the birthday party. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">France is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-16/french-furious-at-biden-for-cutting-them-out-of-submarine-deal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">so infuriated</a> that its foreign affairs minister, Jean-Yves Le Drian, unleashed a tirade against President Biden: “This unilateral, brutal and unpredictable decision” reminded him of former President Donald Trump’s arbitrary and capricious behavior toward France.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>France’s top naval officer, who was in Washington to attend a gala, booked his flight home early after French officials canceled the event in protest.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But remember, France, no take-backs on the Statue of Liberty. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why France is furious:</strong> Australia had signed a contract with a French shipbuilder in 2016 to build nonnuclear submarines, but this week decided to ditch France in order to get its hands on more advanced, nuclear-powered ones. The scrapped deal could cost the French defense industry around $65.7 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The US-led deal is rippling across the globe, angering both China and the EU. One day after the announcement, the EU launched its own Indo-Pacific <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/after-australia-arms-deal-flop-eu-launch-indo-pacific-plan-2021-09-16/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">strategy</a> to beef up its military and diplomatic presence in the region. <em>–SQ</em></p>

<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/16/federal-reserve-announces-ethics-investigation-regional-bank-officials-trading?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Federal Reserve to Regional Bank Presidents
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/16/federal-reserve-announces-ethics-investigation-regional-bank-officials-trading?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Tim Robinson saying "I don't know if you're allowed to do that?"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/qtCUIoD4lka7aWp2We/giphy.gif?cid=790b76110b261265fc0f9b271a5ed6837e52fcf801dad553&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Tim Robinson saying " I don't know if you're allowed to do that?"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/qtCUIoD4lka7aWp2We/giphy.gif?cid=790b76110b261265fc0f9b271a5ed6837e52fcf801dad553&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Federal Reserve <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/finance/572587-fed-reserve-chiefs-orders-ethics-review-after-controversy-surrounding?rl=1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> yesterday that it’s breaking out the ol’ ethics guidelines to look into rules surrounding senior Fed officials' personal investments.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The investigation was launched last week after documents showed that some regional Fed presidents like Boston’s Eric Rosengren held hundreds of thousands of dollars in stocks like Pfizer, Chevron, and AT&T. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Robert Kaplan, the Dallas Fed President, traded more than $1 million worth of individual stocks last year. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And Richmond Fed President Thomas Barkin holds somewhere around $1 million in a mutual fund that invests in big names like BP and ConocoPhillips.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s not </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>technically</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> against the rules. </strong>But it did raise questions as to why three of the 12 regional bank presidents who play a huge role in setting US interest rates and influencing the economy can buy that many Apple shares.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>both Rosengren and Kaplan have agreed to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/09/feds-rosengren-to-sell-individual-stock-portfolio-to-address-ethics-concerns.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sell</a> their individual stocks, but Senator Elizabeth Warren (separately from the investigation) <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/elizabeth-warren-calls-on-fed-banks-to-bar-leaders-from-stock-trading-11631784601?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sent a letter</a> to every regional bank president yesterday asking them to delete their Robinhood accounts and ban all the Fed’s senior officials from trading individual stock. <em>–MM</em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY GE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Questions, Real Change
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="GE" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/4022/1631301249-Twitter_Spaces_2.png">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The world, well, it’s complicated. But lucky for us, there are a lot of smart people out there working very hard to build a world that works.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With that in mind, we are presenting a new series on Twitter Spaces with our partners at GE to get <strong style="color:#000">answers to some of the tough questions facing us in fields like energy, healthcare, and aviation</strong>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hosted by our very own executive chairman, Alex Lieberman will be sitting down with experts in these very important fields for a chat that is as intelligent as it is entertaining (his words, he promised). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All you have to do to be in the virtual audience is keep an eye out in the next week or so for a link to register. Our first chat is on <strong style="color:#000">October 7, covering all things energy</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">No word yet on whether Alex will be changing his name to Lightning Lieberman in preparation.</p>
</td>
</tr>

</table>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/16/key-performance-indicators-september-17?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Lucid Motors car" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDQxL2x1Y2lkX21vdG9yc19jYXIuanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Lucid</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>The Lucid Motors Air Dream Edition was rated as having a <a href="https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1133588_lucid-air-electric-car-520-mile-epa-range-rating-ousts-tesla-from-top-spot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">520 mile-range</a> on a single charge by the EPA, making it the longest-range electric vehicle rated by the agency. That’s more than 100 miles longer than Tesla’s Model S Long Range Plus.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “We know that more people die than would otherwise because of car accidents, but by and large, cars create way more value in the world than they destroy. And I think social media is similar.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Instagram head Adam Mosseri <a href="http://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/16/facebooks-instagram-head-gets-slammed-for-comparing-instagram-to-cars.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">defended</a> the platform on a Recode podcast following a flurry of WSJ articles this week that, among other things, showed that Facebook knows Instagram is <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/14/facebook-knows-instagram-toxic-teens-leaked-documents-reveal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">toxic</a> for teens but hasn’t done much to address it. Some social media users were puzzled by Mosseri’s analogy, pointing out that the auto industry is heavily regulated, unlike social media.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The messy truth around carbon footprints. (<a href="https://undark.org/2021/09/09/the-messy-truth-about-carbon-footprints/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Undark</a>)</p>

MARCH 24:  An Occupy Wall Street banner is seen in Union ...\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDQwL29jY3VweV93YWxsX3N0cmVldF9tYXJjaGUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAndrew Burton/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“Tax the rich”: High fashion in September 2021, perhaps even more fashionable exactly 10 years ago.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn September 17, 2011, Occupy Wall Street began. Protesters first gathered in Lower Manhattan that day, railing against economic inequality and Wall Street’s influence on politics. Thousands set up camp in the neighborhood’s Zuccotti Park, remaining there until they were forced to leave two months later, in November.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile Occupy was centered in NYC, it went global, spreading to more than 600 communities in the US and many cities across the world. Inspired by the Arab Spring protests that had occurred the year before, demonstrators utilized social media in innovative ways to organize what was for all intents and purposes a leaderless movement. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2011, Time magazine named “The Protestor” as its Person of the Year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOccupy’s legacy\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePeople disagree about the long-term impact of Occupy Wall Street, with some calling it a flop and others arguing that it laid the groundwork for other progressive social and political movements.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe flop camp: \u003c/strong\u003eOne year after the protests, the NYT’s Andrew Ross Sorkin called Occupy “an \u003ca href=\"https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2012/09/17/occupy-wall-street-a-frenzy-that-fizzled/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easterisk in the history books\u003c/a\u003e, if it gets a mention at all,” arguing that it didn’t lead to any meaningful policy changes that would reform Wall Street.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven the person who is credited with spurring Occupy, Micah White, who was the editor of an anti-consumerist magazine at the time, told the Guardian he was \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/sep/12/occupy-wall-street-10-years-on?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisappointed\u003c/a\u003e with the outcomes. “I think if you look at the last 10 years, activism has not worked,” he said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe “it mattered” camp: \u003c/strong\u003eOthers argue that, while Occupy may not have accomplished anything concrete, it introduced a generation to protesting and made marching in the streets on a Saturday cool again. They point to #MeToo, Black Lives Matter, and Bernie Sanders’s bid for the presidency as movements that borrowed heavily from the Occupy blueprint. Back\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"France is angry over the submarine deal\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDQzL2FuZ3J5X2Nyb2lzc2FudC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe US, Britain, and Australia signed a major nuclear submarine deal on Wednesday to contain China’s military power in the Pacific Ocean, blindsiding France like the only kid who didn’t get invited to the birthday party. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrance is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-09-16/french-furious-at-biden-for-cutting-them-out-of-submarine-deal?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eso infuriated\u003c/a\u003e that its foreign affairs minister, Jean-Yves Le Drian, unleashed a tirade against President Biden: “This unilateral, brutal and unpredictable decision” reminded him of former President Donald Trump’s arbitrary and capricious behavior toward France.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFrance’s top naval officer, who was in Washington to attend a gala, booked his flight home early after French officials canceled the event in protest.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut remember, France, no take-backs on the Statue of Liberty. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy France is furious:\u003c/strong\u003e Australia had signed a contract with a French shipbuilder in 2016 to build nonnuclear submarines, but this week decided to ditch France in order to get its hands on more advanced, nuclear-powered ones. The scrapped deal could cost the French defense industry around $65.7 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe US-led deal is rippling across the globe, angering both China and the EU. One day after the announcement, the EU launched its own Indo-Pacific \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/after-australia-arms-deal-flop-eu-launch-indo-pacific-plan-2021-09-16/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estrategy\u003c/a\u003e to beef up its military and diplomatic presence in the region. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Federal Reserve \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/finance/572587-fed-reserve-chiefs-orders-ethics-review-after-controversy-surrounding?rl=1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that it’s breaking out the ol’ ethics guidelines to look into rules surrounding senior Fed officials' personal investments.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe investigation was launched last week after documents showed that some regional Fed presidents like Boston’s Eric Rosengren held hundreds of thousands of dollars in stocks like Pfizer, Chevron, and AT\u0026T. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRobert Kaplan, the Dallas Fed President, traded more than $1 million worth of individual stocks last year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd Richmond Fed President Thomas Barkin holds somewhere around $1 million in a mutual fund that invests in big names like BP and ConocoPhillips.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s not \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003etechnically\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e against the rules. \u003c/strong\u003eBut it did raise questions as to why three of the 12 regional bank presidents who play a huge role in setting US interest rates and influencing the economy can buy that many Apple shares.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eboth Rosengren and Kaplan have agreed to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/09/feds-rosengren-to-sell-individual-stock-portfolio-to-address-ethics-concerns.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esell\u003c/a\u003e their individual stocks, but Senator Elizabeth Warren (separately from the investigation) \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/elizabeth-warren-calls-on-fed-banks-to-bar-leaders-from-stock-trading-11631784601?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esent a letter\u003c/a\u003e to every regional bank president yesterday asking them to delete their Robinhood accounts and
